info.headline: Tropical Cyclone Alert : Typhoon HANNA (SOUDELOR)
info.description:
The Typhoon east of extreme Northern Luzon has entered the Philippine Area of Responsibility and was named “HANNA”.
Location of eye/center: At 10:00 AM today, the eye of Typhoon “HANNA” was located based on all available data at 1,380 km East of Calayan, Cagayan (19.6°N, 134.6°E).
Strength: Maximum sustained winds of 195 kph near the center and gustiness of up to 230 kph Forecast Movement: Forecast to move West Northwest at 20 kph
Forecast Positions:
• 24 hour (Tomorrow morning): 910 km East Northeast of Calayan, Cagayan or at 850 km East of Itbayat, Batanes • 48 hour (Friday morning): 375 km East Northeast of Itbayat, Batanes • 72 hour (Saturday morning): 400 km North Northwest of Itbayat, Batanes • 96 hour (Sunday morning): Outside PAR or at 770 km Northwest of Itbayat, Batanes
• Estimated rainfall amount is from moderate to heavy within the 600 km diameter of the typhoon. • Fisher folk are advised not to venture out over the eastern seaboard of Visayas and the seaboards of Mindanao. No public storm warning signal is in effect in any part of the country.
